result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremiah R Aslani was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

--No possession or consumption of illegal drugs
--No possession of drug parpahernalia

Arresting Agency:  Watertown PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

Court presents basis and grants expungement upon successful completion of probation; petition must be submitted by Defendant

supervisions.notes: The Court orders entry of a civil judgment for the balance due on unpaid court-financial obligations.

On Counts #2 & #3 the Court sentences Mr. Aslani serve 6 months in the Jefferson County Jail on each count, concurrent to each other and to any other sentence in being, forthwith.  

These Jail terms are with Huber Release. Mr. Aslani is required to serve the jail sentences with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremiah R Aslani

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
[MK] cases #14CF240 and #14CF272 called at 8:37am.
Defendant Jeremiah R Aslani in court, in custody, with Attorney John V Rhiel.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Plea Hearing held in case #14CF272:
----On Motion of the State, the Court amends Count #1 to Class A Misdemeanor Bailjumping contrary to Statute 946.49(1)(a).
----Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of "Guilty" entered on Counts #1 & #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified (DA Happ submits vicimt restitution information); the Court accepts the pleas, finds Mr. Aslani guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by counsel as to both cases. 
Statement given by Maria Aslani-Kerzman, mother of Jeremiah Aslani.
Statement given by Jeremiah Aslani.


In Case #14CF240:
On Counts #2 & #3 the Court sentences Mr. Aslani serve 6 months in the Jefferson County Jail on each count, concurrent to each other and to any other sentence in being, forthwith.  
These Jail terms are with Huber Release. Mr. Aslani is required to serve the jail sentences with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.
Days credit for time already served:  69 days. 
The Court orders entry of a civil judgment for the balance due on unpaid court-financial obligations.


In Case #14CF272:
On Counts #1 & #2 the Court sentences Mr. Aslani to serve 6 months in the Jefferson County Jail.  Count #1 is consecutive to any other sentence in being; and Count #2 is consecutive to Count #1.
These Jail terms are with Huber Release. Mr. Aslani is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.
 Days credit given as to each count:  0 days. 
The Court STAYS these sentences and places Mr. Aslani on Probation for two years commencing forthwith, with conditions:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to be subject to random drug and/or alcohol screening
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no presence at Pick 'N Save in Watertown
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per the Agent
--to pay restitution of $5.18 to Pick 'N Save of Watertown
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as directed by the Agent
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
 on Count #1
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge on Count #2

Days credit for time already served:  0  days
The Court will not allow any expungement of this record.  
recess 9:25am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 09-28-2015 08:30 am
with JI's, elements and criminal case settlement

Case called at 11:45 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for STC)
Defendant Jeremiah R Aslani in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Counts #2 & #3; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1

On Counts #2 & #3, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 18 months, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Random urinalyses (through JCHS or DOC at least once per month for the first 6 months)
--To maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--No possession or consumption of illegal drugs
--No possession of drug parpahernalia
--No contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent
--To pay costs of $486 ($243 each count)
--To pay $400 DNA Surcharge ($200 each count)
--To pay $75 drug testing fee

Days credit for time already served: 1 day
Court presents basis and grants expungement upon successful completion of probation; petition must be submitted by Defendant
No suspension of driving privileges
Recess: 12:09 pm
Status conference on December 11, 2014 at 11:00 am.

cases #14CF240 and #14CF272 called at 10:29am. [MK]
Defendant Jeremiah R Aslani in court with Attorney John V Rhiel.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Rhiel requests the scheduling of another Status Conference in several weeks-- there is a plea agreement pending that requires Mr. Aslani to continue to show good behavior including clean UA's and no police contacts. 
The Court adjourns.
recess 10:31am

NEXT:  Status Conference on 12/11/14 at 11:00am.  (this date/time was scheduled to accomodate Mr. Aslani's school schedule)

The Court orders that the defendants condition of bail as to contact with Lauren Stiemke shall be modified to allow incidental contact in the school setting for school and class related purposes. In any case, the order still requires that the defendant shall not discuss any aspect of the pending case with Lauren Stiemke at any time. The defendant shall appear within 3 working days from the date of signature of this order to sign the modified bail order.
Status conference on November 6, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Cases 14CF240 & 14CF272 called together at 8:43 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Jeremiah R Aslani in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel. DA Susan V. Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Rhiel: Have had conversations re: resolving both cases, but not quite there yet. Request additional STC in approx. 30 days
DA Happ: No objection
Court confirms address on file is accurate

NEXT: BOTH CASES: (1) Schedule STC 11/6/14 at 9:30 am - Send notices
Status conference on October 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 24, 2014 at 02:20 pm.

Cases 14CF240 & 14CF272 called together at 8:37 am [Clerk SH] 
Defendant Jeremiah Aslani in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Rhiel presents basis for non-appearance of Def. last week, upon questioning of the Court
Court vacates warrants & continues previously imposed signature bond

BOTH CASES:
Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Aslani waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
Court reminds Defendant that bond/conditions of bond remain in effect while case is pending

NEXT: BOTH CASES: (1) DA PTC scheduled for 9/24/14 at 2:20 pm - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 10/7/14 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Preliminary hearing on September 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Cases 14CF240 & 14CF272 called together at 9:43 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for BrIV]
Attorney John Vernon Rhiel in court. DA Susan V. Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Rhiel: Got a call about 1 hour ago from client that ride inadvertantly locked her car keys in her bedroom. Did also speak with Mr. Aslani's mother who confirmed this. She did indicate that there was a locksmith on the way and that she would attempt to get Mr. Aslani another ride. Presents arguments against issuance of warrant.
DA Happ: Requests matter be recalled this afternoon or later in the day as Defendant has not appeared in court, unless in custody. Is global resolution - so assumed would proceed to waiver of preliminary hearing.
Atty Rhiel indicates that he is not available this afternoon
Court orders issuance of bench warrant in each file - Body Only and STAYS warrants until 9/9/14 at 8:30 am - if Mr. Aslani does not appear at that time the warrants will issue.

NEXT: (1) Schedule Preliminary Hearing/STC 9/9/14 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Status conference on August 29, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 13, 2014 at 09:20 am.
original bond document received from JESO 7/18/14

Case called at 1:19 pm [Judge Weston presiding for Branch 3]
Defendant Jeremiah Aslani in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Yelena Zarwell from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office (PD will appoint counsel). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Zarwell stipulates that the video is sight and sound sufficient.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $2,500.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-Absolute Sobriety
-Not to possess or consume any alcohol
-Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
-Take all prescribed medications only as prescribed
-No contact, direct or indirect with LS (9/28/1996) except may have indirect contact by virtue of his parents to make arrangements to retrieve his cell phone
-No contact, direct or indirect S.L.Z. (7/23/1996) or Jeffery Moldenhauer

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

Recess: 1:25 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
PTC: 8/1314 at 9:20 am
Status: 8/29/14 at 9:30 am
